message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.SD, cs.NE 

This paper is about training neural networks for speech recognition, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP) and speech processing. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of natural gradient and parameter averaging, which are optimization techniques commonly used in machine learning, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of GPUs and multi-core machines, which are commonly used in computer vision, making cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) a possible sub-category. The paper also discusses the convergence of stochastic gradient descent, which is a common optimization algorithm used in many areas of computer science, making cs.SD (Systems and Control) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper discusses the use of multiple machines for training, which falls under the category of distributed computing, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category.
